alert.note: Alert for Clay; Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Henry, south central Clay and northwestern Early Counties through 330 PM EDT/230 PM CDT/... At 252 PM EDT/152 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blakely, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blakely, Haleburg, Colomokee, Barnes, Miller, Ferrell Crossroads, Early Co A/p, Hayes and Kolomoki Mounds Sp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
